title: Must Finish Tonight!
desc:
Finish your game while your house gets destroyed. Don't forget to pay attention to hazards!
This one's made in 48 hours as well.

title: Tap Tap Acapella
desc: A rhythm game. My first project in Unity, in 48 hours, and I made a custom Inspector display for the level editor. And apparently, synchronizing visuals with music isn't just about making a timer...

title: flappy amongus
desc: Tiny arcade made as a joke in two hours. I ended up liking it more than I'd like to admit.

title: Those Perished in Valorpath
desc:
Action game without fighting - no steel bears harm! Protect the ghosts of your past deaths so they fight for you.
Made in three days for the third Wowie Game Jam.

title: B-Laze!
desc:
Weird real-time strategy about fast B-Management. Collect pollen, winter's coming!
Made in seven days for the first Brackeys' Game Jam of 2021. Wow, these gamejams are getting longer and longer!!!

title: Losing Socks Sucks!
desc:
Short metroidvania about superpower-giving socks. Wear two at a time, getting a match gives you the power forever.
Made in five days for the Global Game Jam Online of 2021!

title: Squall
desc: Racing game where steering is not as reliable! Use the dash brake or bounce off at the right angle on sharp turns.

title: This Will Be My Cycle
desc:
Platforming game about building your own level. And That will be your suffering.
Made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 47!

title: Blackout Net
desc: Tower Defense game made in 48 hours for GMTK Jam of 2020!

title: Grinternity: Room One
desc: First published game! Boring top-down shooter about incrementing damage numbers.

title: Ball Simulator
desc: Bouncing balls. Use mouse buttons or numeric keys to do stuff.

title: fire/index.html
desc: Fire. Sliders, buttons and tickboxes customize the appearance.

title: Brightest Dungeon
desc: JRPG-style combat demo. Press Q to enable audio (loud warning).

title: Mercile's Power
desc:
Arena platformer with abysmal handling. Bad camera, weird life system, attacks never work (intentionally), but got 3 playable heroes and mobile support.
First game I've ever shown to people.

title: Starlight Soldier
desc:
Shmup with upgrades. First game I finished. Ah, memories... 2014.
W/S to move, Left-click to attract currency to mouse and break asteroids, Shift to fire.
